job_title: Business Development Manager in London, England
pros:
Caring, family friendly, supportive. Fantastic annual leave entitlement: with a 5 day bonus every 5th year! 

I worked for Nacro for 11 years and I worked with some of the most amazing individuals I have ever met.  My career spanned across various locations and differing departments. I thoroughly enjoyed every opportunity and every challenge. Thank you!!

Over the years, I had several managers. Some better than others, but generally very good. Nacro have good policies and procedures and I found managers worked within these boundaries. 

The most recent Manager, a Director, was incredibly supportive and we achieved many great projects together.
cons: I don't believe that any service or process is ever perfect, so I won't be too nit picky.   If my feedback is ever read, I'd like to offer some constructive criticism: reintroducing annual events that gave front line workers, managers and executive leadership teams the chance to talk openly and explore issues / celebrate successes would be good.  After reading some of the comments on here, front line staff believe that there is a disconnect and that managers have lost touch with the delivery.  Although I don't think that this is 100% accurate, I do believe that events will help ease any frustrations that may be felt by delivery staff/ managers.

review_title: Not the best charity to work for.
pros: Staff are good to work with and quite easy going. They were also understanding if you need to take a day off  for something that you need to do to further your career with another company.
cons:
The management where I worked in Rhyl, north wales, were ok to start with and tell you to settle in at your own pace as other's in the office would help me out.
This then changed over night and they gave far to much work to do.
I was supposed to be doing 1 job with another person to cover me and another to do the admin for the project I was on. Then within a week my line manager moved to another project, the office manager got suspended, the person attached to the project resigned and to top it all off the base administrator was made redundant.
So much for support eh!!!
Then I was left to try and do my best to keep the project running, doing most of everything myself. VERY DIFFICULT CHARITY TO WORK FOR WITH CRAP MONEY!!!!

job_title: Senior Project Manager in Birmingham, England
pros: The work Nacro does is understated to the majority of the public, thus when I say who I work for most people think it’s a trade wholesaler…The reality is the work undertaken by Nacro staff has an amazing effect of people lives – people who may be on the edge of offending, substance misuse or just needing support. Working in the support function I rarely meet our clients, but I regular spend time with our front-line-staff who are brilliant – most salient is that people need support 24hrs/day 7-days a week and our staff are there for them. People who are not paid large amounts dedicate their own time to help.. This is generally reflected through the management making Nacro a good place to work – one of the most encouraging factors for me over the last few years is the way Nacro has adopted a far more commercial way of working while not significantly changing the ethos.
cons: The biggest gripe I have is how we struggle to share information around the organisation – it’s difficult when you have a dispersed delivery footprint across England and Wales with very small offices.  We do however regularly reinvent the wheel which duplicates time and resources – this happens right across the work we do and at all levels.

Your views are heard and taken into account. training and development is encouraged and supported.  The Organisation in a sentence 'changes lives'. Great Organisation to work for!
cons: A reduction in Governmental funding has made a serious impact on the Services Nacro can continue to offer and Service/Staff cuts have had to be made of late. But Nacro seems to be over that now and the happy good feelings look like they are back - however cuts in project funding is a constant threat to a charity like Nacro.

I'd have graded it a 5, if we were fully staffed!

My work life hours are balanced,  I go home at 4pm and relax.

I feel valued, with lots of positive comments being made in the office.

An organisation is proactive at supporting people and communities.

Occasional lone working.
